author: hedocode
message:
feat(curriculum): DOM Manipulation and Click Events with JavaScript Quiz (#56487)

Co-authored-by: Ilenia <26656284+ilenia-magoni@users.noreply.github.com>
Co-authored-by: Naomi the Technomancer <accounts+github@nhcarrigan.com>

files.patch:
@@ -17,439 +17,560 @@ To pass the quiz, you must correctly answer at least 17 of the 20 of the questio #### --text-- -Placeholder question +What is the Document Object Model? #### --distractors-- -Placeholder distractor 1 +A programming language used to interact with an HTML page. --- -Placeholder distractor 2 +A JavaScript class you can instantiate to transform HTML into an mutable and serializable JSON object. --- -Placeholder distractor 3 +A set of JavaScript classes representing HTML elements as objects and allowing programmers to interact with it using JavaScript methods. #### --answer-- -Placeholder answer +A web standard representing the elements of an HTML page as a tree graph and how you are supposed to interact with them using code no matter which programming language you use. ### --question-- #### --text-- -Placeholder question +Which of the following sentences is true for a web page? #### --distractors-- -Placeholder distractor 1 +Nodes can have multiple parents. --- -Placeholder distractor 2 +You can access an element siblings using the `siblings` property. --- -Placeholder distractor 3 +Text and comment nodes can be accessed using the `children` property. #### --answer-- -Placeholder answer +The root element is always an html tag. ### --question-- #### --text-- -Placeholder question +How can you use JavaScript to find all HTML anchors with missing hyperlinks? #### --distractors-- -Placeholder distractor 1 +```js +document.findAll("link![href]"); +``` --- -Placeholder distractor 2 +```js +document.find("link:not([href])"); +``` --- -Placeholder distractor 3 +```js +document.querySelector("a![href]"); +``` #### --answer-- -Placeholder answer +```js +document.querySelectorAll("a:not([href])"); +``` ### --question-- #### --text-- -Placeholder question +In JavaScript, how can you remove the last child node of a paragraph element with the `"target"` identifier and replace it with a `"That's it."` text node? #### --distractors-- -Placeholder distractor 1 +```js +const target = document.querySelector("p.target"); +target.remove(target.lastElementChild); +target.appendChild("That's it"); +``` --- -Placeholder distractor 2 +```js +const target = document.getElementById("target"); +target.lastElementChild.replaceWith("That's it"); +``` --- -Placeholder distractor 3 +```js +const target = document.querySelector("p#target"); +target.replaceChild("That's it", target.lastChild); +``` #### --answer-- -Placeholder answer +```js +const target = document.getElementById("target"); +target.removeChild(target.lastChild); +target.append("That's it."); +``` ### --question-- #### --text-- -Placeholder question +Which one of these affirmations is false? #### --distractors-- -Placeholder distractor 1 +The `innerHTML` element's property returns all the HTML content inside it as text. --- -Placeholder distractor 2 +The `innerText` element's property only returns the text content that is shown on screen. --- -Placeholder distractor 3 +The `textContent` node's property returns all the text content inside it. #### --answer-- -Placeholder answer +The `htmlContent` node's property only returns HTML content that is shown on screen. ### --question-- #### --text-- -Placeholder question +Which of the following JavaScript lines do not insert a thematic break at the end of the document body? #### --distractors-- -Placeholder distractor 1 +```js +document.body.insertBefore(document.createElement("hr"), null); +``` --- -Placeholder distractor 2 +```js +document.body.appendChild(document.createElement("hr")); +``` --- -Placeholder distractor 3 +```js +document.body.after(document.createElement("hr")); +``` #### --answer-- -Placeholder answer +```js +document.body.append("
"); +``` ### --question-- #### --text-- -Placeholder question +Which of the following statements is false? #### --distractors-- -Placeholder distractor 1 +`window` is an alias for `navigator.window`: + +```js +window === navigator.window // returns true +``` --- -Placeholder distractor 2 +You can use the user screen properties (like position and size) using the `Window` object. --- -Placeholder distractor 3 +`navigation` is an alias for `window.navigation`: + +```js +navigation === window.navigation // returns true +``` #### --answer-- -Placeholder answer +You can access the clipboard using: + +```js +await browser.clipboard.read(); +``` ### --question-- #### --text-- -Placeholder question +Assuming the JavaScript variable `element` is an HTML `Element` object, which code does not do the same thing as the others? #### --distractors-- -Placeholder distractor 1 +```js +element.toggleAttribute("disabled"); +``` --- -Placeholder distractor 2 +```js +element.hasAttribute("disabled") ? element.removeAttribute("disabled") : element.setAttribute("disabled", ""); +``` --- -Placeholder distractor 3 +```js +element.toggleAttribute("disabled", !element.hasAttribute("disabled")); +``` #### --answer-- -Placeholder answer +```js +element.setAttribute("disabled", !element.getAttribute("disabled")); +``` ### --question-- #### --text-- -Placeholder question +Which of these does not set the element text color to `red`. #### --distractors-- -Placeholder distractor 1 +```html +

...

+``` --- -Placeholder distractor 2 +```html +

...

+ +``` --- -Placeholder distractor 3 +```html + +

...

+ +``` #### --answer-- -Placeholder answer +```html +

...

+``` ### --question-- #### --text-- -Placeholder question +In the case of a click event, which `Event` property returns the clicked sub-element that triggerred the parent's callback? #### --distractors-- -Placeholder distractor 1 +`element` --- -Placeholder distractor 2 +`currentTarget` --- -Placeholder distractor 3 +`type` #### --answer-- -Placeholder answer +`target` ### --question-- #### --text-- -Placeholder question +Which `Event` property returns the HTML element that the event listener was attached to? #### --distractors-- -Placeholder distractor 1 +`target` --- -Placeholder distractor 2 +`element` --- -Placeholder distractor 3 +`type` #### --answer-- -Placeholder answer +`currentTarget` ### --question-- #### --text-- -Placeholder question +Which `Event` function can be called to prevent an event from bubbling up without affecting other listeners on the current target? #### --distractors-- -Placeholder distractor 1 +`stopImmediatePropagation()` --- -Placeholder distractor 2 +`preventDefault()` --- -Placeholder distractor 3 +`composedPath()` #### --answer-- -Placeholder answer +`stopPropagation()` ### --question-- #### --text-- -Placeholder question +Which event is triggered when all the HTML page's elements have been parsed by the browser? #### --distractors-- -Placeholder distractor 1 +`load` --- -Placeholder distractor 2 +`DOMLoaded` --- -Placeholder distractor 3 +`HTMLContentLoaded` #### --answer-- -Placeholder answer +`DOMContentLoaded` ### --question-- #### --text-- -Placeholder question +Which event is triggered when the HTML page and it's resources are fully loaded? #### --distractors-- -Placeholder distractor 1 +`HTMLContentLoaded` --- -Placeholder distractor 2 +`DOMLoaded` --- -Placeholder distractor 3 +`DOMContentLoaded` #### --answer-- -Placeholder answer +`load` ### --question-- #### --text-- -Placeholder question +Which code is not a way to trigger a `validate` function when you click on a `button` element? #### --distractors-- -Placeholder distractor 1 +```html + +``` --- -Placeholder distractor 2 +```html + + +``` --- -Placeholder distractor 3 +```html + + +``` #### --answer-- -Placeholder answer +```html + + +``` ### --question-- #### --text-- -Placeholder question +What statement is false about `setTimeout` and `setInterval`? #### --distractors-- -Placeholder distractor 1 +The first parameter is the function callback and the second is the delay duration in milliseconds. --- -Placeholder distractor 2 +`setTimeout` calls a function once after a delay and `setInterval` call a function continously after an interval delay. --- -Placeholder distractor 3 +They both return a timer's ID that can be stopped, respectively with `clearTimeout(id)` and `clearInterval(id)` functions. #### --answer-- -Placeholder answer +They both are `navigator` properties aliases. ### --question-- #### --text-- -Placeholder question +Using the JavaScript Web animation API, how can you animate an element with `id="square"` to scale it down to `0` in one second. #### --distractors-- -Placeholder distractor 1 +```js +document.getElementById("square").animate( + [ { transform: "scale(0)" }, { transform: "scale(1)" }, ], + { duration: 1 }, +); +``` --- -Placeholder distractor 2 +```js +document.getElementById("square").animate( + [ { transform: "scale(1)" }, { transform: "scale(0)" }, ], + { duration: 1 }, +); +``` --- -Placeholder distractor 3 +```js +document.getElementById("square").animate( + [ { transform: "scale(0)" }, { transform: "scale(1)" }, ], + { duration: 1000 }, +); +``` #### --answer-- -Placeholder answer +```js +document.getElementById("square").animate( + [ { transform: "scale(1)" }, { transform: "scale(0)" }, ], + { duration: 1000 }, +); +``` ### --question-- #### --text-- -Placeholder question +Which method does not exists on an `Animation` object instance? #### --distractors-- -Placeholder distractor 1 +`play()` --- -Placeholder distractor 2 +`pause()` --- -Placeholder distractor 3 +`cancel()` #### --answer-- -Placeholder answer +`stop()` ### --question-- #### --text-- -Placeholder question +You have an HTML page with a 100x100 pixel canvas identified by the `"art"` ID, and the following code: + +```js +const canvas = document.getElementById("art"); +const context = canvas.getContext("2d"); + +ctx.fillStyle = "blue"; +``` + +Which line can you append to print a 50x50 blue square at the center of this canvas? #### --distractors-- -Placeholder distractor 1 +```js +ctx.fillRect(50, 50, 25, 25); +``` --- -Placeholder distractor 2 +```js +ctx.fillRect(50, 50, 50, 50); +``` --- -Placeholder distractor 3 +```js +ctx.fillRect(50%, 50%, 50, 50); +``` #### --answer-- -Placeholder answer +```js +ctx.fillRect(25, 25, 50, 50); +``` ### --question-- #### --text-- -Placeholder question +Let's say you have an HTML `dialog` element stored into a JavaScript variable `welcomeDialog`. It does not show on screen by default. How can you reveal it and then hide it after a one second delay? #### --distractors-- -Placeholder distractor 1 +```js +welcomeDialog.showModal(); +setTimeout( () => welcomeDialog.hideModal(), 1000); +``` --- -Placeholder distractor 2 +```js +welcomeDialog.openModal(); +setTimeout( () => welcomeDialog.closeModal(), 1000); +``` --- -Placeholder distractor 3 +```js +welcomeDialog.show(); +setTimeout( () => welcomeDialog.hide(), 1000); +``` #### --answer-- -Placeholder answer +```js +welcomeDialog.showModal(); +setTimeout( () => welcomeDialog.close(), 1000); +```
